questionTypes.questions: I have difficulty falling asleep
Thoughts race through my mind and this prevents me from sleeping
I feel afraid to go to sleep
I wake up during the night and can't go back to sleep
I worry about things and have trouble relaxing
Despite sleeping all night, I don't feel refreshed when I wake up
I wake up earlier in the morning than I would like to
I lie awake for half an hour or more before I fall asleep
I wake in the morning with muscle or joint stiffness and aches
I feel sad and depressed

comment: Practice good sleep hygiene by avoiding overfeeding, excessive alcohol consumption, and over exercising just before bed time
Stick to a regular sleep schedule
Make relaxation your goal, not sleep
Make sure your bedroom is quiet, dim light or dark, and cool
Turn off all screens at least one hour before bed
Get out of bed when you can't sleep after 20mins
Avoid stimulating activity and stressful situations before bedtime
Practice good sleep hygiene by avoiding overfeeding, excessive alcohol consumption and over exercising just before bed time
Make sure your bedroom is quiet, dim light or dark, and cool
Stick to a regular sleep schedule
Turn off all screens at least one hour before bed
Get out of bed when you can't sleep after 20mins

test.description: Insomnia is a sleep disorder that is characterized by difficulty falling and/or staying asleep

questionTypes.questions: I have been told that I snore
I have been told that I stop breathing while I sleep, although I don't remember this when I wake up
I have high blood pressure
My friends and family say they have noticed changes in my personality
I am gaining weight
I sweat excessively during the night
I have noticed my heart pounding or beating irregularly during the night
I get morning headaches
I have trouble sleeping when I have a cold
I suddenly wake up gasping for breath during the night
I am overweight
I seem to be losing my sex drive
I feel sleepy during the day even though I have slept through the night

comment: Avoid stimulating activity and stressful situations before bedtime
Avoid alcohol, it causes frequent night time awakenings
Quit smoking. Cigarette smoking worsens swelling in the upper airway, making apnea (and snoring) worse
Lose weight
Relaxation training like muscle relaxation, calms the body and induce sleep
Practice breathing exercises, mindfulness and meditation techniques
Avoid alcohol, it causes frequent nighttime awakenings
Quit smoking, cigarette smoking worsens swelling in the upper airway, making apnea(and snoring) worse

test.description: Sleep Apnea is a common and serious sleep disorder that causes your breathing to become shallow or stop completely during sleep

test.testName: Life Event Scale and Stress Test

questionTypes.questions: Have you had any death of a spouse in the past one year?
Have you had any divorce in the past one year?
Have you had any marital separation in the past one year?
Have you had any jail term in the past one year?
Have you had any death of a close family member in the past one year?
Have you had any personal injury or illness in the past one year?
Have you gotten married in the past one year?
Have you been fired at work in the past one year?
Have you had any marital reconciliation in the past one year?
Have you had any form of retirement in the past one year?
Have you had any change in health of family member in the past one year?
Have you had any pregnancy in the past one year?
Have you had any form of sexual difficulties in the past one year?
Have you had any form of gain of a new family member in the past one year?
Have you had any Business readjustment in the last one year?
Have you had any form of change in financial state in past one year?
Have you had any death of a close friend in the past one year?
Have you changed to different line of work in the past one year?
Have you had any change in the number of arguments with spouse in the past one year?
Have you had any mortgage or loan over 22,500,000 in the past one year?
Have you had any foreclosure of mortgage or loan in the past one year?
Have you had any change in responsibilities at work in the past one year?
Have your son or daughter left home in the past one year?
Having any trouble with in-laws in the past one year?
Any outstanding personal achievement in the past one year?
Have your partner began or stops work in the past one year?
Did you begin or end school in the past one year?
Any change in living conditions in the past one year?
Any revision of personal habits in the past one year?
Have you experienced trouble with your boss in the past one year?
Have you had any change in work hours or conditions in the past one year?
Have you had any change in residence in the past one year?
Have you had any change in schools in the past one year?
Have you had any change in recreational activities in the past one year?
Have you had any change in church activities in the past one year?
Have you had any change in social activities in the past one year?
Have you had any mortgage or loan less than #22,500,000 in the past one year?
Have you had change in sleeping habits in the past one year?
Have you had change in number of family get-togethers in the past one year?
Have you had any change in eating habits in the past one year?
Have had any vacation in the past one year?
Have you had any festival celebration in the past one year?
Have you had any minor violations of the law in the past one year?

recommendations.interpretation: A total score of 300 and above show signs that an individual is at risk of illness. It is advised that such persons should see a physician for proper diagnosis and obtain subsequent treatment.
comment: Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

recommendations.interpretation: A total score between 150 and 299 shows that the risk of illness in an individual is moderate. However, this result indicates that such an individual still needs to see a physician to be very sure of his/her status and obtain adequate treatment as the need arises
comment: Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

recommendations.interpretation: A total score below 150 shows an individual is slightly at risk of illness. This however indicates no serious health issue or cause for concern; but it is advised that routine check-ups with a physician would keep one at a zero risk of illness
comment: Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

test.description: A stress test shows how your heart works during physical activity.

questionTypes.questions: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble falling, staying asleep or sleeping too much?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been feeling tired or having little energy?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had poor appetite or over ate?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been feeling bad about yourself, or feeling like you are a failure or that you have let yourself or your family down?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble concentrating on things such as reading the newspaper or watching television?

Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or have been more fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you had thoughts that you would be better off dead, or thoughts of hurting yourself in some way?

recommendations.interpretation: scores on this level indicate that there is a mild level of depression
comment: Be involved in pleasurable activities that will boost your self-esteem and mood
Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises, such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

recommendations.interpretation: scores on this level indicate a clinically significant level of moderate depression
comment: Be involved in pleasurable activities that will boost your self-esteem and mood
Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises, such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

recommendations.interpretation: scores on this level indicate a clinically significant level of moderately severe depression which requires treatment.
comment: Be involved in pleasurable activities that will boost your self-esteem and mood
Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises, such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

recommendations.interpretation: this indicates a clinically significant level of major depression and is diagnosed as major depressive disorder. At this stage, depression causes one to be distressed or agitated, lose self-esteem and entertain feelings of hopelessness, worthlessness and guilt.
comment: Be involved in pleasurable activities that will boost your self-esteem and mood
Healthy eating, such as incorporating fruits & vegetable into your meals
Healthy social support system
Exercises, such as brisk walks, yoga, stretching
Talk to a trusted family member, friend or therapist
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hours

test.description: Personal (Patient) health questionnaire, PHQ-9 is a multi-purpose instrument for screening, diagnosing, monitoring and measuring the severity of depression.

questionTypes.questions: Do you have a pattern of failing to resist impulses?
Do you frequently engage in those behaviors to a greater extent or over a longer period of time than intended?
Do you have persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to stop, reduce or control those behaviors?
Do you spend inordinate amount of time in obtaining the object of addiction and/or engaging in or recovering from the behavior?
Do you have preoccupation with the behavior or preparatory activities?
Do you frequently engage in those behaviors when expected to fulfill occupational, academic, domestic or social obligations?
Do you continue the behavior despite knowledge of having a persistent or recurrent social, academic, financial, psychological or physical problem that is caused or exacerbated by the behavior?
Do you have the need to increase or decrease the intensity and frequency of behaviors to achieve the desired effect or diminished effect?
Are you giving up or limiting social, occupational or recreational activities because of the behavior?
Are you resorting to distress, anxiety, restlessness or violence if unable to engage in the behavior at times?

recommendations.interpretation: You show little to no signs of addiction
comment: Participate in healthy skill(s) training, such assertiveness training
Develop healthy relationships
Engage in healthy coping strategies
Record the times spent on the activity, by using a calendar or journal
Avoid trigger situations, environments and people

recommendations.interpretation: You show signs of addiction; whether you believe it to be mild or harmless, addiction can be damaging to various aspects of your life
comment: Record the times spent on the activity, by using a calendar or journal
Be honest about your addictive behavior towards social support
Healthy social support system
Avoid trigger situations, environments and people
Challenge your thoughts about the addiction by replacing your thoughts on the positive effect of your addiction with the negative consequences
Participate in healthy skill(s) training, such assertiveness training

test.description: Addiction is a persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to stop, reduce or control those behavior.

questionTypes.questions: In the past two weeks do you experience soreness in your muscles?
In the past two weeks do you experience numbness or tingling in any part of your body?
In the past two weeks do you experience strong sensation in your arms or legs?
In the past two weeks do you experience weakness in parts of your body?
In the past two weeks do you experience pain in your heart or chest?
In the past two weeks do you experience hot or cold spells?
In the past two weeks do you experience pain in your lower back region?
In the past two weeks do you experience trouble in catching your breath?
In the past two weeks do you experience faintness or dizziness?
In the past two weeks do you have a lump in your throat?
In the past two weeks do you experience headaches?
In the past two weeks do you experience nausea or stomach upset?

recommendations.interpretation: You show little to no signs of somatoform disorder

You show signs of somatoform disorder. Physical symptoms can be related to psychological distress and a high level of health anxiety. It is vital that professional help from a mental health practitioner is sought immediately, and that treatment is adhered to.
comment: Examine and adapt your beliefs and expectations about health and physical symptoms
Practice stress management and relaxation techniques
Learn how to cope with physical symptoms
Reduce preoccupation with symptoms
Reduce avoidance of situations and activities due to uncomfortable physical sensations
Improve daily functioning at home, at work, in relationships and in social situations
Address depression and other mental health disorders
family support and functioning
Family therapy may also be helpful by examining family relationships and improving
Avoid alcohol and recreational drugs
Have adequate hours of sleep, recommended 7-9 hour.

test.description: Somatization is a tendency to experience and communicate psychological distress in the form of bodily symptoms. More commonly expressed, it is the manifestation of physical symptoms of a mental health condition such as anxiety.
